intro: Linociera harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's linociera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is thick and corky, which helps it survive in its native environment. Linociera harmandii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
